hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Narrative Spillover from BTC Dominance Breakdown
hypothesis_content.statement: If BTC fails to capitalize on a macro catalyst (like options expiry) and BTC Dominance (BTCD) breaks below a key support (e.g., 54.5%) on rising volume, capital will rotate aggressively into ETH and large-cap alts, amplifying their outperformance by 2-3x over the following 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: When BTC fails to rally on a clear catalyst, it signals fatigue or distribution. A breakdown in dominance confirms capital rotation. This triggers momentum chasers and portfolio rebalancers to pile into altcoins, creating amplified relative strength moves as attention shifts.
entry_conditions: BTC catalyst event occurs (e.g., post-expiry) but BTC price underperforms (< 0.5% move)
BTCD 4H close breaks below 54.5% (key weekly support)
ETH/BTC pair 4H candle closes above its 20-period MA with volume > 1.3x avg

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio increases by 4% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: BTCD break fails to sustain, or ETH/BTC ratio fails to rally within 24 hours of break (no follow-through).
